title: Create UD/UCMDB custom roles
content:
Note Make sure that you have enabled Native SACM so that you can use the Service Management agent interface to manage UD/UCMDB users, roles, and groups.

Create roles

If the seeded UD/UCMDB OOTB roles can’t meet your requirements, follow these steps to create new custom roles as the tenant admin:

  1. Log in to the Service Management agent interface (https://<EXTERNAL_ACCESS_HOST>/dashboard?TENANTID=xxxxxxxxx) as the tenant admin.
  2. From the main menu, select Administration > Master Data > People > Roles.
  3. Click Add at the top of the left pane. The New Role page appears.

  4. Provide values for the following parameters:

    Field (*required) Description
    Name * Name of the new role. 
    Code * Unique name of the new role. This is used to identify the role internally for the selected application.
    Application  * Select CMDB from the drop-down list to indicate the CMS-specific role.
  5. Click OK.

Create users

To create users, follow these steps as the tenant admin:

  1. Log in to the Service Management agent interface (https://<EXTERNAL_ACCESS_HOST>/dashboard?TENANTID=xxxxxxxxx) as the tenant admin.
  2. From the main menu, select Administration > Master Data > People > People.
  3. Click New on the toolbar. The New person page appears.
  4. Provide values for the following parameters:
    Field (*required) Description
    First Name * First name of the new user.
    Last Name * Last name of the new user.
    Name * Name of the new user.
    Create user * Select the checkbox.
    Create user with DB authentication * Select the checkbox. Note that this parameter is visible only after you select Create User.
    Email * Email address for the user. 
    User principal name * Login name for the new user.
  5. Click SAVE.

(Optional) Associate users with a role

After creating users, you can associate UD/UCMDB roles with the users directly if you don't want to create groups.

To do this, follow these steps:

  1. Log in to the Service Management agent interface (https://<EXTERNAL_ACCESS_HOST>/dashboard?TENANTID=xxxxxxxxx) as the tenant admin.
  2. From the main menu, select Administration > Master Data > People > People.
  3. Click the user in the ID column to display the selected user.
  4. From the System use definitions section, click in the Role box to display a list of available roles, and then select the role that you want to associate with the user.
  5. Click SAVE.

Create groups

To create custom groups, follow these steps as the tenant admin:

  1. Log in to the Service Management agent interface (https://<EXTERNAL_ACCESS_HOST>/dashboard?TENANTID=xxxxxxxxx) as the tenant admin.
  2. From the main menu, select Administration > Master Data > People > Groups.
  3. Click New on the toolbar. The New group page appears.
  4. Provide values for the following parameters:
    Field (*required) Description
    Name * Name of the new group. 
    User principal name * Unique name of the new group. 
    Group type* Select Functional from the drop-down list.
    Note You can't include special characters in the User principal name field, including space and these characters: @;:=&<>#{}|`^~%'?\"/[].
  5. Click SAVE & EDIT. The group details page appears.

Associate users and roles with a group

After you create a group and click SAVE & EDIT, you can associate the users and roles with the group: 

  1. From the group details page, go to the Group members section, click Add, and then search for and select the user that you want to add to the group.
  2. In the System use definitions section, select the role with the 'CMDB' field that you want to assign to the group.
  3. Click Save on the toolbar.

Synchronize newly added groups and roles from IdM to UCMDB

By default, the system automatically synchronizes groups and roles from IdM to UCMDB every 2 minutes.

To check the synchronization status, follow these steps:

  1. Log in to UCMDB Local Client of the UCMDB Consumer customer as the tenant admin.
  2. Go to Security > Users and Groups, and then go to the Groups tab in the navigation pane.
  3. Click the Check Sync Status  button. The information of the last synchronization status displays like this:

If you want to change the interval time for the synchronization, follow these steps as the tenant admin:

  1. In UCMDB Local Client of the UCMDB Consumer customer, go to Administration > Infrastructure Settings > Security Settings, and then select Set the interval minutes for IDM group sync.

  2. Edit the setting and save your changes.

    Notes:

    • The value must be an integer indicating how many minutes of the synchronization interval.
    • Set the value to 0 to disable the automated synchronization of groups and roles from IdM to UCMDB. Then, you need to trigger the synchronization manually by clicking the Sync Groups/Roles from IDM button.

Grant UD/UCMDB permissions to synchronized roles

After the groups and roles are synchronized from IdM to UCMDB automatically, define permissions for the synchronized roles in UCMDB Local Client of the UCMDB Consumer customer as the tenant admin.

  1. Define Permissions for the Role Using the Resources Tab

    Your new role is selected by default in the Roles pane. Select the Resources tab in the right pane and follow these steps:

    1. Select a resource type in the Resource Types pane (for example, Views).

    2. Select a resource (for example, a specific view from the view tree in the Available View pane) and click the right arrow button. The Set Permissions dialog box opens. (For UI Modules and CIT Menu Items, the Set Permissions dialog is not relevant.)

    3. In the Set Permissions dialog box, select the required permissions for the resource you selected. You can choose Select All to assign all the available permissions. Click Apply.

    4. Your selected resource appears in the right pane with the check boxes for the assigned permissions selected.

    5. Repeat this procedure for other resources of this type and for other resource types, as required.

      For details, see UCMDB Roles Manager user interface.

  2. Define Permissions for the Role Using the Resource Groups Tab

    Select the Resource Groups tab in the right pane and follow these steps:

    1. Select a resource group in the Resource Groups pane.

    2. Select actions from the tree in the Available Actions pane (for example, Update permission under Views) and click the right arrow button.

      Note You can make multiple selections by holding the CTRL key.

    3. The actions you selected appear in the Selected Actions pane. Each selection defines permission for that action for every resource of that type in the resource group (for example, Update permission for every view in the resource group).

      For details, see UCMDB Roles Manager user interface.

  3. Define Permissions for the Role Using the General Actions Tab

    Select the General Actions tab in the right pane and follow these steps:

    1. Select actions in the Available Actions pane.

      Note You can make multiple selections by holding the CTRL key.

    2. Click the right arrow button to move them to the Selected Actions pane.

    3. The general actions selected are permitted for the role (they are not linked to a specific resource or resource type).

      For details, see UCMDB Roles Manager user interface.

  4. Save the Role

    Click the Save button in the Roles pane to save your changes.
